macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Indexes Mixed on Friday Amid Inflation Data and AI Worries
items.summary: The Dow Jones rose 0.1% to 49,500.93, S&P 500 edged up less than 0.1% to 6,836.17, Nasdaq fell 0.2% to 22,546.67, and Russell 2000 gained 1.2% to 2,646.70, following easing Treasury yields after a report showed slowing inflation. Weekly losses included S&P 500 down 1.4%, Dow down 1.2%, Nasdaq down 2.1%, with year-to-date S&P slightly negative and Dow up 3%.

items.title: CPI Report Matches Expectations, Easing Yields but No March Fed Cut Priced In
items.summary: January CPI data came in as expected, leading to falling Treasury yields around 4.1% on the 10-year, supporting hopes for mid-year rate cuts despite low odds for March. Markets show divergence with bond signals warning of S&P distribution patterns.

items.title: Tech Sector Volatility Rises on AI Disruption Fears, Growth Stocks Lag
items.summary: Nasdaq 100 down over 3% YTD versus Dow up 1.5%; Thursday saw Cisco drop 12% on margin pressure and Nasdaq fall 2%, with software ETFs down 2% amid AI-related swings. Value stocks and international markets like MSCI Emerging up 11% YTD outperform.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Rebounds 4% to $68,864 Amid Weekly Declines
items.summary: Bitcoin rose over 4% on Saturday to around $68,864 after weeks of sharp declines, but analysts warn of potential further downside and a possible 'bitcoin winter' with muted volumes and bearish forecasts.

items.title: US Crypto Bill Stalled Over Stablecoin Yield Disputes
items.summary: The US Senate's cryptocurrency market structure bill is stalled due to disagreements on stablecoin profits, with bankers pushing for a ban and the Digital Chamber of Commerce proposing a compromise allowing rewards for liquidity and DeFi participation.

items.title: Standard Chartered Predicts Bitcoin Crash to $50,000
items.summary: Standard Chartered forecasts Bitcoin dropping to $50,000 and Ether to $1,400 soon due to ETF outflows and risk-off sentiment, with revised 2026 year-end targets lowered across major cryptocurrencies amid early-year market volatility.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: PlayStation State of Play Reveals Major 2026 Titles Including God of War Trilogy Remake
items.summary: Sony's February 12 State of Play showcased announcements like God of War Trilogy remake, Beast of Reincarnation release on August 4, Dead or Alive 30th anniversary titles, untitled John Wick game, and Marathon's March launch with Server Slam preview.

items.title: Ubisoft Faces International Strike by 1200 Workers Over Job Cuts and RTO Mandate
items.summary: Ubisoft employees launched strikes in response to massive layoffs, return-to-office policies, and cost-cutting measures, amid industry-wide challenges post-COVID growth.
items.source: The Ancient Gaming Noob / RPS / Polygon

items.title: The Seven Deadly Sins: Origin Sets March 16 Launch on PS5 and Steam
items.summary: Netmarble confirmed the release date for the action RPG The Seven Deadly Sins: Origin, allowing early access on PlayStation 5 and Steam starting March 16.

items.title: UNDERDEEP Dungeon RPG Launches Crowdfunding Campaign Today
items.summary: Indie studio Hakony started a crowdfunding drive for its new dungeon RPG UNDERDEEP on February 14, seeking support for development.

items.title: Silent Hill Townfall and Castlevania: Belmont's Curse Announced at State of Play
items.summary: New trailers revealed for Silent Hill Townfall and Castlevania: Belmont's Curse during PlayStation State of Play, alongside Metal Gear Solid: Master Collection Vol. 2.

items.title: Pokémon Pokopia Builds Hype with Onsite Demo at European Championships
items.summary: Ahead of its Nintendo Switch 2 exclusive March release, Pokémon Pokopia offers a demo at the 2026 Pokémon European International Championships, featuring a 20-40 hour main story.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Indian IT Stocks Plunge Amid AI Disruption Concerns
items.summary: Indian IT stocks experienced significant selling pressure on February 13, 2026, with the Nifty IT index dropping 4-6% intraday to levels not seen since October 2023, driven by renewed concerns over AI-led disruption to traditional IT services.

items.title: Coinbase Posts $650M+ Loss in Q4, Shares Rebound in Premarket
items.summary: Coinbase reported a loss exceeding $650 million in the fourth quarter, though shares rebounded in premarket trading following the earnings announcement.

items.title: Defense Sector Eyes $163B AI Drone Market Opportunity
items.summary: The aerospace and defense sector is positioning itself at a critical juncture as the US Department of Defense dedicates resources to drone technology, with a $163 billion market opportunity identified.

items.title: Sumitomo Forestry Announces Share Acquisition
items.summary: Sumitomo Forestry Co., Ltd. announced on February 13, 2026, that its Board of Directors resolved to acquire shares in a corporate development move.
